nodes.bodyText: this sounds a bit hacky, the best would be to create a junit rule and before the call just record rule.expect(ReadTimeoutException.class)
I would remove this since the exception fails the test, and it's better to have that reported then to hide it
this can now be removed because if the exception is not thrown, JUnit it will fail it since it was expecting it
Good point.  I forgot to remove that.  It is done.
